data.title: Chinese cities (Civ6)
data.meta_description: Chinese cities are cities that can be founded by the Chinese civilization in Civilization VI and its expansions. The first city founded is the Capital, and the names of future cities are chosen at random from the list below. The names listed are default names; players can change their cities...
data.text: City Name Notes Capital Xi'an (under Qin Shi Huang) Current capital of Shaanxi province; one of the Four Great Ancient Capitals of China; home of the Terracotta Army Beijing (under Kublai Khan and Yongle) Current capital of China; one of the Four Great Ancient Capitals of China; home of the Forbidden City Shendu (under Wu Zetian) Historical name of Luoyang (q.v.) during the rule of Wu Zetian Cities Taiyuan Capital and largest city of Shanxi province Chengdu Capital of Sichuan province Jiaodong Peninsula in Shandong province Changsha Capital of Hunan province Longxi Historical name of Gansu province that derived from a Qin prefecture; now a district of Dingxi, Gansu Guangzhou Capital of Guangdong province Handan Former capital of the State of Zhao during the Zhou dynasty; now a prefecture-level city in Hebei province Shenyang Capital of Liaoning province, formerly known by its Manchu name Mukden Shanghai Biggest city in China Wuhan Capital of Hubei province Yiyang Prefecture-level city on the Zi River in Hunan and one of the earliest settlements in the province Xiurong Historical name of Xinzhou, Shanxi during the 4th and 5th centuries Chen A Zhou dynasty vassal state in modern Zhoukou, Henan Xingzhou Historical name of Xingtai, Hebei Quxian County in Sichuan province Nanjing Current capital of Jiangsu province, one of the Four Great Ancient Capitals of China Langfang Smallest prefecture-level city of Hebei Province by land area; known as Yuyang during the Qin Dynasty Linzi Former capital of the State of Qi during the Zhou dynasty；now a district of Zibo, Shandong Jiujiang The second-largest prefecture-level city in Jiangxi province Kaifeng Former capital of the Song dynasty, one of the Eight Ancient Capitals of China Xuzhou Major city in Jiangsu province Hefei Capital of Anhui province Xinzheng Small county-level city of Zhengzhou in the south of Henan province Lu’an Prefecture-level city in Anhui province Qufu Hometown of Confucius; now a county-level city in Jining, Shandong Jiangzhou Historical name of Chongqing during the Qin Dynasty, or of Jiujiang during the Tang Dynasty Luoyang One of the Four Great Ancient Capitals of China in modern Henan that usually served as co-capital with Xi'an; renamed Shendu (q.v.) when led by Wu Zetian
